inputs.name: features
inputs.label: Feature(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the feature file(s) to publish. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**\*.feature` for all feature files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Augurk Instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: Augurk instance to which the features should be published.

inputs.name: productName
inputs.label: Product Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the product under which the features should be published to Augurk.

inputs.name: productDescription
inputs.label: Product Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a Markdown file containing a description of the product being published to Augurk.

inputs.name: useFolderStructure
inputs.label: Use folder structure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether the folder structure in which the feature files are placed is used to create groups within Augurk. If this option is checked, the name of the parent folders of each feature file is used as a group name. Otherwise set the group name explicitly below.

inputs.name: groupName
inputs.label: Group Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the group under which the features should be published to Augurk.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the feature files being published. Supports variables (in the format $(<variable-name>).

inputs.name: embedImages
inputs.label: Embed images
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this option if you want images referenced in feature files to be embedded so they can be viewed in Augurk.

inputs.name: useIntegratedSecurity
inputs.label: Use Integrated Security
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether integrated security should be used when communicating with the Augurk instance.

inputs.name: language
inputs.label: Language
inputs.helpMarkDown: Language in which the feature files have been written. For example: `en-US` or `nl-NL`.

inputs.name: augurkLocation
inputs.label: augurk.exe Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to where the command line augurk.exe tool is located. This is usually installed through the Augurk.CommandLine NuGet package. If this package is installed the default will suffice, otherwise another path must be specified.

inputs.name: additionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional argument(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Any additional command line arguments you want to pass to augurk.exe

inputs.name: treatWarningsAsErrors
inputs.label: Treat warning(s) as error(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether warnings issued by this task should be treated as errors.
